name: Tomatoes
fertilise: Tomato fertiliser high in potassium, every 10–14 days after first flowers.
care_1: Support the plant as it grows.
care_2: Pinch new shoots at the junction between main stem and branches.
care_3: Remove lower leaves to focus energy on fruit growth.
harvest_signs: Fruits are full in colour. Firm but not too hard. Tomatoes happily come off the stem.

name: Potatoes
fertilise: General-purpose potato fertiliser or blood fish & bone, at planting and again at flowering.
harvest_signs: Leaves turn yellow and die back.

name: Green beans
fertilise: Balanced vegetable fertiliser, every 3–4 weeks once flowering starts.
care_1: Provide support as the plant grows.
care_3: Add mulch to the base of the plant.

name: Carrots
fertilise: Avoid high nitrogen; rake in general fertiliser before sowing only.
care_2: Using loose sandy soil is important.
care_3: Thin out seedlings during planting phase.
harvest_signs: The carrot is full in size and bright in colour.

name: Garlic
fertilise: Light feed with general fertiliser at planting; no further feed needed.
harvest_signs: The tops above ground are yellow/brown and begin to flop.

name: Lettuce
care_2: Pick outter leaves for continuous harvest.
care_3: Add 2-3" mulch around lettuce for water retention.

name: Radishes
fertilise: None needed if soil is fertile.
care_2: Thin out seedlings during planting phase.
care_3: If left in the ground too long, they become tough and woody in flavour.
harvest_signs: The top of the radish will become visisble and be about 1" in width.

name: Courgettes
fertilise: High-potassium feed (tomato fertiliser) every 10–14 days after first flowers.
care_2: Water around the base of the plant.
care_3: Add mulch to the base of the plant.

name: Beetroot
fertilise: Light general feed at sowing; no further feed unless soil poor.
care_2: Thin out seedlings during planting phase.
care_3: Maintain consistent moisture but not water logged.
harvest_signs: The top of beetroot will be visible and is 2-3" in width.
